abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit for Albania was rated as satisfactory with
            likely sustainability and institutional developmental
            impact.  Both the Bank and Borrower performed
            satisfactorily. Implementation of the PRSC was affected by:
            (i) political change and frequent fiscal revisions; (ii)
            occasional bypassing of civil service procedures; (iii) the
            sudden decision to decentralize operations and maintenance
            of primary and public health care; (iv) data constraints;
            and (v) coordination between the Ministry of Local
            Government and the line ministries on decentralization.
            Findings and implications for subsequent operations include:
            more work is needed to drill the public expenditure and
            civil service reforms down to the sectors; the Government is
            being assisted with the preparation of expenditure
            contingency plans that can protect priorities during fiscal
            revisions; subsequent PRSCs will focus more on
            accountability reforms; and co-team leadership is an
            effective vehicle for reaching internal consensus on
            difficult policy issues - however, it also does result in
            transaction costs.
